intro: Calomecon orientale, commonly known as the oriental calomecon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and often endangered species.
